SIP.note: a cybersecurity document for software delivery

HTTP.name: Hypertext Transfer Protocol

CMS.name: content management system OR compliance management system

CMP.note: first is a cybersecurity term; second is a legal term
CMP.name: configuration management plan OR civil money penalty

FTP.note: a standard network protocol for the transfer of files

IGA.note: part of the External Affairs Division
IGA.name: Office of Intergovernmental Affairs

CTA.note: a standard feature of a CFPB web page or document

NCES.note: a part of the Department of Education

ES.note: a search server based on Lucene

AIGA.note: host of an annual design conference

D&D.note: a department within Technology and Innovation

OCR.name: Offic of Civil Rights OR optical character recognition

18F.name: a digital services delivery group in the GSA; the name reflects the office location at 18th and F

JA.note: our framework for automating Jenkins deployments

OFCIO.note: part of the Office of Management and Budget

IP.name: Internet Protocol

IR.note: first is a a cybersecurity term

IA.note: first is software term, second is a cybersecurity term

IG.note: there are 73 federal offices of inspectors general

ECMC.name: Educational Credit Management Corporation

DRY.note: a noble goal for writers of code and other things

EPP.note: hosted by the National Finance Center

CCB.name: Change Control Board OR Configuration Control Board

PIF.note: former is a Project Management Office document

PIP.note: the Python term is a recursive acryonym, standing for "Pip Installs Packages"

DBA.name: database administrator OR doing business as

BDD.name: behavior-driven development

TEP.note: helps review technical aspects of CFPB contracts

PMO.note: three bureau offices that coordinate project work
